issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: When deleting a scaling group, it goes away after the dialog is closed, then it comes back and lingers for some time until it gets removed again.
fields.summary: Deleted Scaling Group lingers on the landing page for 30+ seconds

comments.body:
This lingering event occurs when there exists more than one scaling group in the landing page, and the deleted security group contains at least one running instance.

So it seems like the reappearance of the deleted scaling group has to do with the running instances associated with the scaling group.

Any idea, [~jpommer]?
This issue much more apparent on AWS than Eucalyptus although I did witness the case on Eucalyptus.

This could the implementation mismatch between AWS and Eucalyptus. When monitoring the attributes of the deleted scaling group, this new attribute was noticed:

"Status":"Delete in progress"

, thus the deleted scaling group "lingers" until the delete progress is complete. For this reason, we were seeing the deleted scaling group on the landing page for some prolonged period on AWS.

Now, the question for [~sjones], [~kgill], [~dkavanagh], and [~jloza] is, does Eucalyptus also support this "Status" attribute for the deleted scaling group? If so, then how should we handle the display of such delete-in-progress scaling groups?
Currently you will not see a group with the status "Delete in progress" with Eucalyptus as it is deleted synchronously.
I see. That explains why this problem only appears on AWS although I believe that in some cases, I was also seeing this on Eucalyptus as well.
Perhaps this issue could just be documented as a KI?

That could be a possibility. Or, if we try to add consistency in the behavior, then the proxy can just filter out the scaling groups that have the status set to be "Delete in progress". That's just one suggestion.
[~kyolee] that sounds like a good idea if we can do that on the proxy. [~dkavanagh] should take a look. Thanks!

Typically, we've managed filtering by state in the browser because that's part of the view. One thing I'd like to look at more before 3.4.1 goes out is some latency issues I've noticed with data showing up on the landing pages. I'm going to write up an issue and assign it to me for 3.4.1, just so I remember.

Hi [~kyolee] and [~dkavanagh], I still see the ASG disappearing then coming back and lingering. It lingered for about 10-15 seconds which is less severe. Was the fix supposed to eliminate the instance disappearing and coming back, or just make "lingering" less severe? Movie attached.

That's strange. The deleted scaling group should never reappear on the landing page. 

Is it the latest maint/3.4/testing?

I will double-check as well.

[~alice] Tested on both Chrome and Firefox on AWS, but I couldn't reproduce the issue. What you were seeing is the exact behavior prior to this fix. Could you describe more on what the steps were to see the issue?
Hi [~kyolee], I tested it on an eucalyptus account with the latest code from maint/3.4/testing. The setup is still up: https://10.111.5.8:8888 usual users.
Hi [~kyolee], I saw lingering ASG on FF 25 ui-test-acct-00/user00 https://10.111.5.8:8888, but not on Chrome.
